Posts.Content: I am four weeks post Auxillary  node disection and mastectomy, and my pain seems to be getting tighter with cords on chest and under arm ...they have told me to just keep stretching ..which is very painful and it feels like my skin has been melted with an iron and stuck ... just another thing to add to everything else ha ...`they said it will eventually disperse so lets keep stretching it out ..good luck with your journey xxx
Posts.Title: Painful cording

Posts.Content: Hi Crystal ... i know how you are feeling as just a few weeks ago i was in the same position waiting to find out if it had spread to my lymph nodes and sadly mine had spread to my  they found two out of five were infected ... this broke my heart but like all of us after the initial shock of hearing this news and a couple of days in mourning we somehow accept the situation then on to the next thing.. i then had a auxilary clearance and im in recovery week three... `i`m waiting to find out if or how many more nodes were infected and when i will see and oncologist ....its such an emotional journey for everyone that has to go through this good luck ..let me know your outcome xxxx
Posts.Title: anxiety between mastectomy and lymph results

Posts.Content: Hi DebBee25,  I'm sorry to hear you have to go through this operation.  I know how you feel as I am just recovering from my second operation (mastectomy then auxillary node removal on my left side).  My emotions have varied from thinking I can handle this, no problem to sheer fear and emotional breakdowns; I am sure this is normal for everyone going through this.   People very often don't know what to say and I can assure you that I had the same said to me over and over again, but we know that it's our own journey and it's going to be very hard.  I am trying to take one step at a time and just focus on the one thing that's coming up next.  I hope that you have a good support network as I have found my friends and family are wanting to help any way they can.  I have 3 children - twins of 8 and a 7 year old - and we have taken the help that our friends have offered us.   Good luck with your operation and keep me posted. A xx
Posts.Title: feeling sad angry lonely and lots more

Posts.Content: Hi  Mad h ... thank you for your reply I have my last appointment with my surgeon Next Friday March 6th and then he will pass me on to an Oncologist ...it just seems forever waiting to find out more ... not everyone will want to know the ins and outs of their cancer and some say ignorance is blind ....but i do and feel they may skim over something that i may feel of a concern? its the waiting game eh... is this common or is not the majority? i really don`t know ... thanks for the reply xx
Posts.Title: my invasive lobular carinoma tested positive for being pleomorphic...

Posts.Content: Thank you Dreamtheif for you reply would you know if this quit normal or rare to fund this at a?, i am waiting for an app to come through to see an oncologist which feels like forever... with lots of questions that need answers xxx
Posts.Title: my invasive lobular carinoma tested positive for being pleomorphic...

Posts.Content: Aww thanks Dreamtheif Yes i think it may be a more aggressive form , but i feel if i know a little bit that when the oncologist does tell me i wont break down ha ... it`s been an emotional few months with this second operation taking its toll on my body my left side is very sore and numb.. and it`s harder to do the excercise each day but i`m feeling so much brighter than i have done in a while... only to soon find out what chemo i will have ..this Friday 6th is an app with my surgeon... is it worth asking him? or maybe just wait until i see the oncolgist!  but thank you so much great explanation! xxxx
Posts.Title: my invasive lobular carinoma tested positive for being pleomorphic...

Posts.Content: Yes i feel the same  Irish girl and cant help but think after going through all that lies ahead that we are high risk of it returning! its hard  as everyone says its brlliant news its only two nodes infected.. but i cant help  feeling its not brilliant news i still have a high risk cancer that is known to return! and i like you i know i will get the full works ... i still have to recover from this second op and its a waiting game before i see the oncologist ... my surgeon did admit to me that my cancer is rare and more aggressive though! but i`m feeling ok today the sun is shining and i`m inbetween treatments so i will make the most of spending time with my children twins of 8 and a 7 year old xxx i know how you feel but if you are like me one day you think you can handle it but the next it`s all to much ..we are here if you need to let off steam sending love and hugs your way xxx
Posts.Title: my invasive lobular carinoma tested positive for being pleomorphic...

Posts.Content: As i was looking back though my diagnosis letter i noticed i had tested positive for pleomorphic? i have invasive lobular cancer and recently had a left mastectomy and a radical auxillary node disection ....Im waiting for an app to see the surgeon and then an oncologist ...but in the mean time i wondered if anyone can shine a light on what this may mean? xxxx
Posts.Title: my invasive lobular carinoma tested positive for being pleomorphic...

Posts.Content: Hi Irish Girl I`m actually ER positive.... so can i ask you what treatment they have given you and did your oncologist tell you the truth about pleomorphic  LCIS  or do they just brush over the facts? xxxx thank you for the reply and good luck with chemo xxxx
Posts.Title: my invasive lobular carinoma tested positive for being pleomorphic...
